div.p: P90/3101, unit 611, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.
MS written by G. Luehmann and signed by M. Melbourne, 14th March 1890

I have the honor to request, that you will please to permit me to retain the services of two youths,
George French and Arthur Luehmann. who have been engaged in my branch since the 1st of January with your consent, and whose term will expire on 31st March, for a further period of three months. They are employed 4 days a week, and receive a remuneration of respectively 4/ and 3/ a day, paid out of my vote for Contingencies.
Deakin approved M's request on 19 March 1890, and on 21 March M returned the file 'with best thanks'. The Under Secretary, T. Wilson, subsequently forwarded the file to the Commissioners of Audit 'for their information'.
The initial request in M to A. Deakin, 23 December 1889 had been approved, but when renewal was again requested in M to T. Wilson, 1 July 1890, only one of the youths was permitted to be retained. M opted to retain George French.
